nl.nsi.demo.echo

Class NSInternationalSpeechlet

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.nsi.demo.echo.NSInternationalSpeechlet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.amazon.speech.speechlet.Speechlet

    public class NSInternationalSpeechlet
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.amazon.speech.speechlet.Speechlet
    This class contains all the functionality of the skill and will handle all the requests and intents.

    • Method Detail

      • onSessionStarted

        public void onSessionStarted(com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SessionStartedRequest request,
                             com.amazon.speech.speechlet.Session session)
                      throws com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SpeechletException
        This function is the first to be called when the skill is activated, in here the date and time are set for use in the requests. The Amazon user ID is collected and stored. And the database is called to see if this is a new user, if the user is new isNewUser is set to true.
        Specified by:
        onSessionStarted in interface com.amazon.speech.speechlet.Speechlet
        Parameters:
        request - Amazon sends this to the lambda function. Contains request ID.
        session - Contains the user ID, session ID and authentication token.
        Throws:
        com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SpeechletException - A SpeechletException

      • onLaunch

        public com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SpeechletResponse onLaunch(com.amazon.speech.speechlet.LaunchRequest request,
                                                              com.amazon.speech.speechlet.Session session)
                                                       throws com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SpeechletException
        This function is called when the skill is activated without an intent, "Alexa, Start NSI". It checks if the user has an access token, if not it returns a linkaccountcard, if yes it adds the user to the database. This function calls the getUpdatedResponse.
        Specified by:
        onLaunch in interface com.amazon.speech.speechlet.Speechlet
        Parameters:
        request - Amazon's LaunchRequest, contains requestID.
        session - Amazon's Session, contains Session ID, accesstoken and User ID.
        Returns:
        A speechletResponse from getUpdatedResponse
        Throws:
        com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SpeechletException - A SpeechletException.

      • onIntent

        public com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SpeechletResponse onIntent(com.amazon.speech.speechlet.IntentRequest request,
                                                              com.amazon.speech.speechlet.Session session)
                                                       throws com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SpeechletException
        This function is called when the skill is activated with an intent. A function corresponding to the intent is called. It also checks if the user is new and if the user has an access token.
        Specified by:
        onIntent in interface com.amazon.speech.speechlet.Speechlet
        Parameters:
        request - IntentRequest contains requestID and the Intent.
        session - Session contains session ID.
        Returns:
        Returns a speechletResponse from the correct function.
        Throws:
        com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SpeechletException - A SpeechletException.

      • onSessionEnded

        public void onSessionEnded(com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SessionEndedRequest request,
                           com.amazon.speech.speechlet.Session session)
                    throws com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SpeechletException
        This function is called after the skill has done its thing. Created by Amazon. Cleanup logic goes here.
        Specified by:
        onSessionEnded in interface com.amazon.speech.speechlet.Speechlet
        Parameters:
        request - SessionEndedRequest, amazon stuff.
        session - Session, amazon stuff.
        Throws:
        com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SpeechletException - A SpeechletException.

      • getTravelerResponse

        private com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SpeechletResponse getTravelerResponse(com.amazon.speech.slu.Intent intent)
        This function is called when the intent equals "Traveler". It asks the NS International API for all the connections corresponding to the date,time,origin,destination and arrival or departure. And selects a maximum of 3 connections to read back to the user. If connections could be retrieved the boolean journeyHasBeenSelected is set to true.
        Parameters:
        intent - a Traveler intent
        Returns:
        Returns a speechletResponse

      • getChooseIntentResponse

        private com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SpeechletResponse getChooseIntentResponse(com.amazon.speech.slu.Intent intent)
        This function is called when the intent equals "ChooseIntent" and the boolean journeyHasBeenSelected equals true. It creates a provisional booking for the selected journey and mails it to the user. It also gives a quick recap of the selected journey, and sends a card to the interface with a picture.
        Parameters:
        intent - a ChooseIntent intent
        Returns:
        a speechletResponse

      • getUpdatedResponse

        private com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SpeechletResponse getUpdatedResponse()
        This function is called when the skill is activated without an intent. It gets the first journey from the database, and checks if it is delayed.
        Returns:
        a speechletResponse

      • getLocationIntentResponse

        private com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SpeechletResponse getLocationIntentResponse(com.amazon.speech.slu.Intent intent)
        This function is called when the intent equals "LocationIntent". It stores the station of the selected city under the identifier of the location in the database. Identifier must be home or work.
        Parameters:
        intent - a LocationIntent
        Returns:
        Returns a speechletResponse

      • getCompositionIntentResponse

        private com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SpeechletResponse getCompositionIntentResponse(com.amazon.speech.slu.Intent intent)
        This function is called when the intent equals "Composition Intent". It stores the number of people the user wants to book tickets for in the database.
        Parameters:
        intent - a CompositionIntent
        Returns:
        Returns a speechletResponse

      • getCheapestOption

        private com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SpeechletResponse getCheapestOption(com.amazon.speech.slu.Intent intent)
        This function is called when the intent equals "Cheapest". If a cheapest journey already has been selected, it will execute bookCheapestOption. If no cheapest journey has been selected, it will execute getCheapestOptionFromServer
        Parameters:
        intent - a Cheapest intent
        Returns:
        Returns a speechletResponse

      • getCheapestOptionFromServer

        private com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SpeechletResponse getCheapestOptionFromServer(com.amazon.speech.slu.Intent intent)
        This function is called when no cheapest journey has been selected. It returns the cheapest date and price for the journey from the origin to the destination. If the origin is empty Amsterdam Centraal is selected. After the cheapest date and price is returned, the user can book the journey.
        Parameters:
        intent - a Cheapest intent
        Returns:
        Returns a speechletResponse

      • bookCheapestOption

        private com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SpeechletResponse bookCheapestOption()
        This function is called when the cheapest journey has been selected. It creates a provisional booking and sends an email to the user.
        Returns:
        a speechletResponse

      • addUser

        private void addUser(java.lang.String accestoken)
        This functions adds a user to the database, it asks the amazon api for name and email using the accestoken. The user is stored in the database with the Amazon User ID, Amazon name and Amazon email.
        Parameters:
        accestoken - String containing the accesstoken from Session

      • newUser

        private com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SpeechletResponse newUser()
        This function is called when the user is new, it asks the user for how many people the user wants to book a ticket.
        Returns:
        Returns a speechletResponse

      • linkaccountCard

        private com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SpeechletResponse linkaccountCard()
        This function is called when no accesstoken is available, it tells the user to link his amazon account with the skill.
        Returns:
        a speechletResponse

      • createDestinationImage

        private com.amazon.speech.ui.Image createDestinationImage()
        This function is called when a journey has been selected.
        Returns:
        returns an image corresponding to the destination.

      • initializeDateandTime

        private void initializeDateandTime()
        This function is called to initialize the date and time, it selects the current date and time. And stores it in the variables date and time

      • parseTime

        private java.lang.String parseTime(java.lang.String newTime)
        Parse the time from HH:mm to HHmm
        Parameters:
        newTime - String in the format HH:mm
        Returns:
        Returns a String in the format HHmm

      • parseDate

        private java.lang.String parseDate(java.lang.String newDate)
        Parses the data from YYYY-MM-DD to YYYYMMDD
        Parameters:
        newDate - date String in the format YYYY-MM-DD
        Returns:
        date String in the format YYYYMMDD

      • delegateDirective

        private com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SpeechletResponse delegateDirective()
        This function is called for a dialog with the user. If information is missing from the intent, then this function will ask for more information from the user.
        Returns:
        Returns a speechletResponse

      • newAskResponse

        private com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SpeechletResponse newAskResponse(java.lang.String stringOutput,
                                                                     java.lang.String repromptText,
                                                                     com.amazon.speech.ui.StandardCard card)
        Wrapper for creating the Ask response. The OutputSpeech and Reprompt objects are created from the input strings.
        Parameters:
        stringOutput - the output to be spoken
        repromptText - the reprompt for if the user doesn't reply or is misunderstood.
        card - the card to be shown to the user on the alexa web interface
        Returns:
        SpeechletResponse the speechlet response

      • newAskResponse

        private com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SpeechletResponse newAskResponse(java.lang.String stringOutput,
                                                                     java.lang.String repromptText)
        Wrapper for creating the Ask response. The OutputSpeech and Reprompt objects are created from the input strings.
        Parameters:
        stringOutput - the output to be spoken
        repromptText - the reprompt for if the user doesn't reply or is misunderstood.
        Returns:
        SpeechletResponse the speechlet response
